Besok, Jalur Pendakian Gunung Rinjani Dibuka Lagi
05 Nov 2019, 19:29 by Harianto Nukman


Ilustrasi Gunung Rinjani (Foto: dok. BTNGR)

Mataram - Jalur pendakian Gunung Rinjani sempat ditutup akibat kebakaran hutan dan lahan (karhutla). Kini jalur resmi pendakian tersebut akan segera dibuka lagi.Kebakaran hebat sempat terjadi di dalam kawasan konservasi Taman Nasional Gunung Rinjani (TNGR). Akibatnya, semua jalur pendakian Gunung Rinjani dinyatakan ditutup sejak 20 Oktober 2019 yang lalu.Ssetelah melalui pembahasan hasil dari tim survei, kini Balai TNGR memutuskan untuk membuka kembali jalur resmi pendakian Gunung Rinjani. "Iya, pak. Baru selesai diputuskan. Dibuka besok (Rabu, 6/11), pak," ujar Kepala Balai TNGR Dedy Asriady pada detikcom, Selasa (5/11/2019).Pelbagai pertimbangan dan beberapa masukan dari banyak pihak perlu dilakukan terkait rencana kegiatan pemulihan kembali ekosistem yang ada di dalam kawasan.Sebelumnya, kebakaran hutan terjadi di jalur pendakian Gunung Rinjani, Lombok, NTB. Pascakejadian, Balai Taman Nasional Gunung Rinjani (BTNGR) menutup semua jalur pendakian. "Semua jalur pendakian Gunung Rinjani ditutup. Terhitung mulai 20 Oktober 2019 sampai batas waktu yang belum ditentukan," kata Plh Kepala BTNGR Dwi Pangestu saat dimintai konfirmasi, Minggu (20/10).Simak Video "Cantiknya Fenomena 'Topi Awan' Gunung Rinjani"[Gambas:Video 20detik](msl/msl)

Tomorrow, the Mount Rinjani Climbing Path is Opened Again
05 Nov 2019, 19:29 by Harianto Nukman


Illustration of Mount Rinjani (Photo: doc. BTNGR)

Mataram - Mount Rinjani climbing route was closed due to forest and land fires (karhutla). Now the official route of the climb will soon be opened again. Severe fires had occurred in the conservation area of Mount Rinjani National Park (TNGR). As a result, all hiking routes of Mount Rinjani were declared closed since October 20, 2019 ago. After discussing the results of the survey team, the TNGR Office now decided to reopen the official hiking routes of Mount Rinjani. "Yes, sir. It has just been decided. Opened tomorrow (Wednesday, 6/11), sir," said Head of TNGR Office, Dedy Asriady, on Tuesday (11/05/2019). Various considerations and some input from many parties need to be done related to the plan to restore ecosystems in the area. Previously, forest fires occurred in the hiking trail of Mount Rinjani, Lombok, NTB. Pascakejadian, the Mount Rinjani National Park Hall (BTNGR) closes all hiking trails. "All climbing routes of Mount Rinjani are closed. As of October 20, 2019 until an unspecified deadline," said Acting Head of BTNGR Dwi Pangestu when asked for confirmation on Sunday (10/20).
